item.title: Report X-2025020199
item.description:
Report X-2025020199

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2025020199 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED. 2. X-2025020200 RMP NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING WHILE AUDITING THE HAZMATS. RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION. RESPONDER NOTED THAT THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING DUE TO A LOOSE CAP/LID.

item.title: Report X-2025020212
item.description:
Report X-2025020212

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUP NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE ON FLOOR AND CALLED RESPONDER WHO DISCOVERED AMAZON PACKAGE WITH ONE SIDE SOAKED. REINFORCED SECURITY TAPE ACROSS TOP AND BOTTOM SEAM. ARROWS ON THE BOX BUT NOT IN THE DIRECTION THAT CANS WERE ORIENTATED. INSIDE THERE WAS NO INNER PACKING, 18 AEROSOL CANS, MOST OF THE PLASTIC LIDS WERE CRACKED AND CANS HAD SPRAYED.

item.title: Report X-2025020115
item.description:
Report X-2025020115

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO A CHECK ON A LEAKING PACKAGE. REPONDER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER EVALUATION. RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE OF THE TWO BOTTLES WAS SHATTERED. ONLY ONE OF TWO BOTTLES HAD A MOLDED FIBER PROTECTION ON THE LID AND NEITHER OF THE BOTTLES HAD PROTECTION ON THE BOTTOM OTHER THAN THE CORRUGATED CARDBOARD BOX.
